Title: Cheniere plans major expansion of Sabine Pass plant, boosting share of US LNG export market
Description: The largest LNG producer in the US, Cheniere, plans to significantly boost capacity at its 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG export plant, a move that would enlarge its share of the U.S. LNG export market.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s Wintershall will not invest in LNG liquefaction or regasification capacities
Description: German oil and gas company Wintershall Dea will not become an LNG infrastructure investor either in liquefaction or in regasification capacities, the company’s CEO Mario Mehren announced on Feb. 23. Wintershall also confirmed its exit from Russia, joining many other Western companies which exited their Russian gas and oil assets following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Author: DE

Title: Spain’s El Musel terminal gets regulator’s greenlight, needs more approvals to start
Description: Spain’s 8 bn m3 El Musel LNG terminal received the energy regulator’s green light last week but needs to receive several more approvals before it can start operations. The terminal was initially planned to start in January as a transit point between global LNG supplies and other EU-based import terminals to further support the European Union’s security of supply.
Author: DE

Title: QCLNG shuts one train for maintenance until early March, APLNG extends maintenance
Description: The QGC-operated 8.5 mtpa Queensland Curtis LNG plant has shut one of its two trains for maintenance until Mar. 8, while the 9 mtpa Australia Pacific LNG plant has extended its scheduled maintenance in early March by a day. The maintenance schedules for the two plants on Australia’s east coast were announced on the Australian Energy Market Operator’s (AEMO) gas bulletin board today.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG prepares to load first LNG output after partial commercial restart approved
Description: US LNG producer Freeport LNG is gearing up to load the first LNG cargo to be produced at its 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island, Texas, in almost nine months, following regulatory approval two days ago for partial commercial operations to begin.
Author: CK
